description: The Ministry of Health and the President of Panama, Laurentino Cortizo Cohen, in Decreto Ejecutivo No. 490, establish a daily and repeating curfew for all citizens and foreigners in the country, starting March 17th, 2020. Between the hours of 21:00 and 05:00, everyone is to remain in their homes unless leaving for a medical emergency or if they are an essential worker outlined in Article 2 of the Decree.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 18, Panama announced a nation-wide curfew from 21.00 to 05.00, in attempt to guarantee the safety and health of its citizens and to mitigate the effects of the pandemic.The exceptions to this measure include police and other law enforcement groups, hospitals and health centers, markets and supermarkets, security companies and securities transport and public transport for health reasons or contracted by exempt establishments.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 18, Panama announced a nation-wide curfew from 21.00 to 05.00, in attempt to guarantee the safety and health of its citizens and to mitigate the effects of the pandemic.The exceptions to this measure include police and other law enforcement groups, hospitals and health centers, markets and supermarkets, security companies and securities transport and public transport for health reasons or contracted by exempt establishments. On March 23, this curfew was announced to be extended from 17.00 pm to 05.00 am, to take effect the next day on March 24.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Ministry of Health and the President of Panama, Laurentino Cortizo Cohen, in Decreto Ejecutivo No. 490, establish a daily and repeating curfew for all citizens and foreigners in the country, starting March 17th, 2020. Between the hours of 21:00 and 05:00, everyone is to remain in their homes. The exceptions to this measure include police and other law enforcement groups, hospitals and health centers, markets and supermarkets, security companies and securities transport and public transport for health reasons or contracted by exempt establishments. On March 23, this curfew was announced to be extended from 17.00 pm to 05.00 am Monday-Saturday. On Sundays, nobody is supposed to leave their home. UPDATE: Extend the Curfew measure from 9PM-5AM to 5PM-5AM, daily, beginning on March 23rd.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Government of Panama is enforcing a mandatory curfew on all citizens and foreigners effective April 1st, 2020. First, people are allowed to leave their homes only during a two-hour window assigned to them by the last digit of their ID or passport number. These two-hour blocks begin at 6:30 AM and end at 7:30 PM; after which, all people are expected to be indoors. Secondly, the curfew policy further restricts movement by gender. Females are allowed to circulate on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. While nobody may circulate on Sundays.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Government of Panama is enforcing a mandatory curfew on all citizens and foreigners effective April 1st, 2020. First, people are only allowed to circulate in public during a two-hour window assigned to them by the last digit of their ID or passport number. These two-hour blocks begin at 6:30 AM and end at 7:30 PM; after which, all people are expected to be indoors. Secondly, the curfew policy further restricts movements by gender. Males are allowed to circulate on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays. While nobody may circulate on Sundays.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The government of Panama and the Ministry of Health announce that on the 22nd of March, all international flights will be suspended for a period of thirty days. This excludes humanitarian flights and those necessary to transport cargo and products, medical-hospital equipment, medicines, vaccines and any other public health supplies necessary to face the pandemic.

target_geog_level: All countries

description: The government of Panama and the Ministry of Health announce that on the 22nd of March, all international flights will be suspended for a period of thirty days. This excludes humanitarian flights and those necessary to transport cargo and products, medical-hospital equipment, medicines, vaccines and any other public health supplies necessary to face the pandemic. On June 17, The Government of Panama extended the suspension of international commercial passenger flights to July 22.

description: On July 17, the Government of Panama extended the suspension of international commercial passenger and domestic charter flights, originally announced on March 26, for an additional 30 days beginning July 22. description:
Sri Lanka is temporarily suspending all types of visa issuance to enter Sri Lanka. This policy will take effect from 2020.03.17 until further notice.

UPDATE: The original policy was in effect until further notice for all countries/nationalities except for Canada, Belgium, Norway, United Kingdom, Qatar, Bahrain, France, Spain, Germany, Denmark, Netherlands, Sweden, Austria, Italy, Iran and Republic of Korea. Total lockdown is to remain in effect for the remainder of the State of Emergency, or until another policy is stated.

description: Panama is suspending the judicial work in the Second Court of Niñez y Adolescencía of the First Judicial Circuit of Panama starting August 3rd due to the fact that an official of the court tested positive for COVID-19 in order to sanitize the office.
type_text: An official of the second court of Niñez y Adolescencía of the First Judicial Circuit of Panama tested positive for COVID-19. As such, that court has suspended as judicial terms and work as of August 3rd in order to sanitize and disinfect. There is no information on when work will return.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description:
On the 7th of March, Panama's Ministery of Health activated hotline 169. This phone-service functions to register alleged cases, and to answer questions from people who have been in contact with people from at risk countries and are at risk of contracting COVID-19 themselves. 
The hotline will function 24h a day to register cases. The callcenter is available to answer questions between 08.00 and18.00 pm. During this time, phone operators are to work under the guidance of 10 health specialists.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: As of August 24, the Government of Panama has opened the following sectors of the economy: real estate, wholesale trade, housing development, property appraisal, beauty salons and barber shops (not including esthetics), some private and public construction, non-governmental organizations (NGO’s), mining of non-metals, industry, car repair shops, technical services, and small scale fishing. Religious sites, parks, social areas, and sporting areas are allowed to operate at 25 percent capacity. In Los Santos, Herrera, and Cocle provinces, car sales and professional and administrative services are also authorized. Allbusinesses must meet health and safety requirements. The dates for opening additional sectors of the economy remains unknown.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Hygiene and sanitation measures required,Restriction of number of customers
